text: Cythara coniformis is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Mangeliidae. This species is considered a nomen dubium. ==Description== The length of the shell attains 9 mm. The thin, whitish shell is rather transparent. It is faintly plicate on the upper part of the whorls and transversely very faintly striated.G.W. Tryon (1884) Manual of Conchology, structural and systematic, with illustrations of the species, vol. VI; Philadelphia, Academy of Natural Sciences ==Distribution== This marine species occurs off Hawaii ==References== ==External links== * Tucker, J.K. 2004 Catalog of recent and fossil turrids (Mollusca: Gastropoda). Zootaxa 682: 1–1295. coniformis Category:Gastropods described in 1839
title: Cythara coniformis
